DOC.brief_summary: A phase 1 study DCR-PH1 patient primary hyperoxaluria type 1 ( PH1 ) determine safety , tolerability , pharmacokinetic ( PK ) pharmacodynamics ( PD ) effect DCR-PH1 administer via-intravenous infusion ( IV )
DOC.brief_title: A Study DCR-PH1 Patients With Primary Hyperoxaluria Type 1 ( PH1 )
DOC.criteria: Male female , least 12 year age Diagnosis PH1 , confirm genotyping 24hour urine oxalate excretion define protocol eGFR ≥ 40 mL/min normalize 1.73 m2 BSA Written inform consent adult ( ≥18 year old , per local regulatory requirement ) ; write informed assent adolescent ( 12 < 18 year old , per local regulatory requirement ) Prior renal and/or hepatic transplantation Participation clinical study involve administration investigational drug within 30 day enrollment Pregnancy lactation time screen enrollment Women childbearing potential must negative pregnancy test , breastfeed must willing use contraception Patients know history human immunodeficiency virus ( HIV ) active infection hepatitis B virus hepatitis C virus Moderate severe liver impairment Liver function test abnormality : alanine transaminase ( ALT ) and/or aspartate transaminase ( AST ) > 2 time upper limit normal ( ULN ) History severe reaction liposomal product know hypersensitivity lipid product . Unable collect require study sample follow study procedures No clinically significant health concern
